explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of a neural network model for financial risk early warning, which is a machine learning approach.
explanations.supervised learning: The back-propagation neural network (BPNN) algorithm used in the paper is a supervised learning method, as it involves training on labeled data to predict financial risks.
explanations.neural network: The paper constructs a project investment risk early-warning model using a back-propagation neural network (BPNN) algorithm.
explanations.backpropagation: The paper specifically mentions the use of a back-propagation neural network (BPNN) algorithm for risk early warning.
explanations.BP: BP is short for backpropagation, which is the algorithm used in the neural network model described in the paper.
explanations.hidden layer: The paper discusses determining the number of hidden layers in the improved BPNN algorithm through orthogonal experiments.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the performance of the GA-improved BPNN algorithm with support vector machine (SVM) algorithms.
explanations.SVM: SVM is short for support vector machine, which is one of the algorithms compared against the improved BPNN in the paper.
